alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 10:20PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Rock Island, western Scott, Muscatine and southeastern Cedar Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1019 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rochester to near Muscatine. Iowa City gusted to 50 mph with these storms. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Durant around 1025 PM CDT. Walcott, Fairport and Illinois City around 1035 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Blue Grass, Donahue, Montpelier, Davenport, Eldridge, Buffalo, Andalusia, Long Grove, Reynolds, Taylor Ridge and Rock Island. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 266 and 295. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and east central Iowa.
